1.content:
"Wait a minute. What just happened?" I look around myself and shake my head to get that light out of my eyes. Everything's blurry. "My body!" I slap my hands in several places to see if I'm still alive - yes, but that strange whizzing sensation that just went through me…God, I rub my eyes. Things are becoming clearer. What happened, where am I. OK, I'm at work, tool bag on; vision keeps blurring, gotta look closely - don't recognise anything. I bend over and touch the ground - what the hell are these, flowers? The long thin shafts come up halfway to my knees. I stumble around trying to get out of the flower bed, but it doesn't seem to end. I reach my hand out to the wall - cement - where's the house - cement up, cement down. What is this? My vision is slowly becoming clearer - I look up to the roof, but what's that above it? It…what is this, a skyscraper? Where am I - we're not building a skyscraper. "Tom!" I yell out for one of my co-workers, "Frank!" No answer; lota hammering going on. I yell louder. My vision is… what the fuck!! I look around again, down at the grass, up at the plywood shell, over at the 2x4 scraps piled in a mountain, down at my body. "I'm only six inches tall!!!"

Suddenly I hear voices and run for cover behind the long 2x6's propped against the wall. I look out cautiously to see Frank and Tom walk by.

"Where is he?"

"I don't know - I could've sworn I heard his call, but it sounded far away over in that direction."

"I don't see him. I told him to nail up the rest of this plywood over here. We've gotta get this done today. I've got a huge, tight schedule, and I don't have time to go looking after the labourers!"

"I could've sworn I heard him call from over here," said Frank.

115.content:
By the time I saw him again, I had tried numerous manoeuvrers to get more comfortable. I tried several times to climb up the chalk line, bracing my feet on the wall like a rock climber. I finally got to the nail, and hoisted myself up onto it, but it didn't provide the comfort I expected. I had to constantly shift my balance as I sat on it, either sideways, or with my back to the wall, and the nail sticking out between my legs. I thought of cutting the line with my pliers, but what then? Finally I needed a change from nail squatting, and lowered myself back down to hang and wait.

I was greatly relieved when I saw Frank again. He came over and bent down so he was eye level with me, and I shouted, "Please! Let me down from here!" He lifted the rope above me, and picked it up pretty far - I thought so he could cut it, but then he let it go, and I found myself slamming into the wall. I screamed.

"Oh sorry," he said without much conviction, and then came around to the side, filled his lungs with air, and started blowing on me.

"Whoa," I shouted as I flew into the air, and tried to brace my feet on the wall to get some leverage.

"Get yer fucking feet off the wall or I'll smash you against it." Needless to say, I obeyed. He blew at me again, and I swung back and forth, twisting on the chalk line. Then he batted me back and forth between his hands, and tried my best to keep curled up so as to get hurt least.

Finally, he was bored, picked up his gear, and said, "So long, shrimp, maybe they'll find you tomorrow."

"Wait," I pleaded, "Please don't leave me here, please take me down; take me with you, please!"

Standing naked as the day I was born on the floor of the truck, with the man's huge, dirty boot just beside me, threatening to crush me, I tried to wonder what had happened to me to put me in this situation, but the threat of his giant foot crushing me was too much to be able to think straight. Then, the truck started to slow down. I wondered if we had arrived at Frank's house, where only God knew what horrible fate was waiting for me. But it wasn't Frank's house. Frank had stopped the car to pick somebody up, and as the passenger door opened, I saw who it was.

It was Frank's son, Will. Will was a senior in high school, and had recently "come out" to his parents. Frank had been complaining about it nonstop at work ever since it had happened, but I got the feeling he wasn't half as angry with his son about it as he seemed. He just wanted something to fume about.

"Get your queer-ass in the car, Son!" Frank roared. His abrasiveness was obviously not reserved even from his own son. "Have a good day?"

"Yeah," replied Will quietly. Even from first glance, it was obvious that Will was nothing like his father. Whereas Frank was loud, obnoxious, and downright mean, Will was quiet and respectful, even in the face of the severe rudeness his father showed him. Yeah, I think it's safe to say: I liked Will from the moment I saw him... not in a gay-way, mind you....... just, he's a likeable kid....

And that's when it happened. Frank was going on shouting at his son, "... and I'd better not be hearing about you makin' out with none of those fag friends of yours!... And to help keep that from happening, I got you something..."

Before I even knew what was happening, Frank had reached down to the floor of the truck and wrapped his beefy fingers around me once more. A second later, my naked self was dropped directly onto the warm crotch of Frank's teenage son. I stared up at his hazel eyes and he looked down at me, both of us in utter surprise.

Will looked as different from his father in appearance as he was in personality. His frame was thin and skinny. He was kind of tall and gangly, and his short hair was a very light brown, as opposed to Frank's dark hair. He wore thin, black-wire glasses which hid his pretty eyes from being as noticeable as they should be.

"If you get... some kind of urge... or somethin', just use him. That way, I don't hav' ta' think about you makin' out with some real guy, and all that." Frank finished. Neither Will nor I heard this but faintly. We were both far too taken aback by the new situation for words...

it is another action figure ( his back is to you)
15412.content: As the door opens you quickly hide behind a plie of comic books in a corner. Looking out you see it is a differnt boy then the one who you rode here. The young boy is carring a bag of somthing in his hands.
